description: Redevelopment of site for Business Class development (Use Classes B1, B2, B8)
decision_conditions: Approval of the details of the siting, design and external appearance of the building(s) and the landscape design of the site (hereinafter called "the reserved matters") to reflect the  revised "Urban Design Framework" dated February 2001;  shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON: The application is in outline form only and is not accompanied by full detailed plans; and in order to achieve the comprehensive mixed use development of the entire `Gypsy Corner` site to regenerate this part of Park Royal; and ensure the development is carried out broadly in accordance with the submitted Urban Design Framework and Environmental Statement for the adjacent site. | Application for approval of the reserved matters in respect of all phases/parts of the development hereby approved shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development permitted shall be  begun either before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the last reserved matter to be approved, whichever is the later.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and achieve a high quality appearance. | Development shall not begin until drainage works have been carried out in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved to be carried out before the development is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development  permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the amenity of the area. | The development shall not be occupied until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning authority and theses works shall be carried out as approved prior to occupation of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the development shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. | Details of the arrangements to ensure the continued maintenance of all landscaped areas within the development shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that the landscaping is properly maintained to provide a satisfactory screen and setting for the development. | The development shall not be occupied until a plan indicating the  positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the development is occupied and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area. | Details of any floodlighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is brought into use. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the amenity of the area. | Activity in the premises associated with the permitted use shall not result in an increase in the existing weekday daytime background noise level of 38 dB(a) expressed as L50. All machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closest.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties. | No goods or materials shall be stacked or deposited on the site , and no operations carried out unless within a roofed and enclosed building.  REASON: To protect the amenity of the area. | There shall be no vehicular access to the development on this site from the A40 Western Avenue or Wales Farm Road.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety and free flow of traffic. | Prior to first occupation provision shall be made for vehicles to enter and leave the site in forward direction, in accordance with a scheme which shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local planning Authority, and thereafter  permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety. | Details of car parking provision shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development. Such provision approved to be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that parking provision is sufficient to meet operational needs and accords with the restraint policies adopted by the Local Planning Authority. | The details of acoustic treatment and means of ventilation to building(s), shall be provided before the building(s) are occupied or brought into use, and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the occupiers and neighbours from noise and pollution. | The site coverage with building(s) shall not exceed 75% of the site area, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of the reserved matters application(s).  REASON:  The application is in outline only, and to prevent an inappropriate over development of the site. | The plot ratio of the development on the site shall not exceed 2:1, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of the reserved matters application(s).  REASON:  The application is in outline only, and to prevent an inappropriate over development of the site. | The first use of the building(s) hereby granted by this outline permission shall become the lawful use of the building(s).  Any material change in use of the building(s) thereafter shall require planning permission.  REASON:  To ensure that the Local Planning Authority maintains strict control over the use(s) on site in the interests of the amenity and proper planning of the area. | A construction strategy  shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any development in relation to any phase/part of the development hereby approved and thereafter implemented as approved. Such strategy shall address the following matters: + limiting hours of noise nuisance + Keeping nearby accesses free from obstruction and segregating construction and general traffic + No burning of waste on site + The suppression of dust + The location and means of enclosure of sites for the storage of plant, materials and construction staff accommodation + Means of securely enclosing construction sites + Any temporary traffic control measures + Temporary and permanent access to works + Any temporary road layouts + Roads to be used by construction traffic and safeguards to prevent or limit damage + The display of site notices informing residents of likely disruption including information on, and operating of, a complaints system + Continuity of existing services + Protection of the general public from health hazards + Location and management of crushing, grinding and cutting operations + Avoidance of blasting + Public highway cleansing + Sheeting of lorries during transportation of materials + Controls to limit noise and vibration + Treatment of any asbestos in accordance with BS 6187 and Health & Safety Executive Guidance Notices G8/29/1, 3, 4 & 5 and other relevant statutory requirements and regulations + Transportation and tipping in accordance with section 17 of the Control of Pollution Act and the Transport of Hazardous Waste Regulations  REASON: To ensure that any loss of residential amenity and general disruption are minimised during the construction process related to the total development hereby approved. | Details of areas of the public and private areas of the development subject to CCTV surveillance coverage, shall be approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented thereafter in accordance with details so agreed prior to completion and occupation of each phase/part of the total development.  REASON: To promote community safety.
